sections.MISSION:
C TRP executes Squad Situational Exercise on TA 4 from 07-11 Dec 24 IOT certify each squad’s ability close with and destroy the enemy.
COMANCHE TRP SQD STX Packing List 07-11 DEC 24
SQD Equipment: 163 w/ both antennas, hand mic, two batteries 1x Skedco per squad w/CLS Bag Methods of Marking
VS-17 panel Chalk
Glint tape Chemlights IR/GREEN/RED
Packing List: Worn: OCPs w/subdued flag, all patches
Cold Weather Boots w/inserts
Applicable cold weather gear as needed
MSV w/front, back, side plates, camelback, IFAK, NVG Pouch, 7xmags, or pouches for AR
Rhino mount w/J-arm for NVGs
Compass (SL/TL) Protractor (SL/TL) Rangeer Handbook (SL/TL) Nomex gloves
Eyepro (Clear) Earpro Red lens headlamp
BFA
Notebook/Pen
Ruck: Full Sleep System (Heavy bag, Light Bag, Bivy Cover) Wet Weather Top/Bottom
Wet Weather Bag or Black trash bag (place clothes inside) Poncho w/Poncho liner Silk Top/Bottom
Waffle Top/Bottom
Soft Shell Top/Bottom 8x Socks
8x Tan T-shirts
3x OCPs Extra Pair of Boots Fleece Cap
AA Batteries (provided by PLT) 3V Batteries (provided by PLT) Terrain Model Kit (SL) Hygiene Kit w/baby wipes, razors, shaving cream, toothbrush, toothpaste, chapstick Neck Gator or Face shield
4.
sections.COORDINATING INSTRUCTIONS:
– HHT provide MEV and medic
Uniform: Dragoon Standard
5.
sections.CMD AND SIGNAL:
Signal
Primary: Troop CMD Net (TSM)
Alternate: EUD
Contingency: GSM
Emergency: Emergency Services: 112
OIC: 1LT Power
RSO: SFC Escalante
Medic: CPL Hammen
MEV: HHT-73
sections.PURPOSE: – Train and certify all maneuver squads IOT prepare and develop maneuver squads for SQD LFX.
sections.KEY TASKS:
Conduct Maneuver of a Squad (071-326-5611)
React to Direct Fire while dismounted (07-SQD-D9601)
Conduct an Ambush (071-450-0036)
Conduct an Attack (07-SQD-D9514)
Defend Against Hostile Low, Slow, Small (LSS) Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS's) (44-BTRY-1000)
Enter and Clear a Room (07-4-D9509)
3.
sections.EXECUTION:
. This phase begins with TAA established and ends with the final police call of the training area. Key to this phase is the completion of 1x day iterations per squad, 1x night iteration per squad, squads certified by troop commander, and deliberate route planning by squads mounted maneuver.​
Phase 4: Reconsolidation. This phase begins with the final police call of the training area and ends when the Troop has arrived back at Troop AO. Key to this phase is dunnage clearance and accountability of all MWE. ​
4.
sections.SUSTAINMENT:
Class I – A/M/A (SP with 3 DOS), water buffalo
Class III – SP full tanks and fuel cans
Class IV – 6x pallets, 2x strands C-Wire
Class VIII – 1x CLS bag per Squad

values: Soldiers wear Full Dragoon Standard during execution.
Leaders continuously monitor Soldiers during live fire execution to ensure proper shooting fundamentals.
Soldiers have been taught proper handling of weapons systems.
Soldiers will not handle or fire weapons systems with which they are unfamiliar or untrained.
Ammo Point will fully separate all types of ammunition, be it live, blank, or different DODICs IAW Range SOP V.
There will be no mixing of ammunition types when issued to training Soldiers.
Safety Brief, CONOP, Training Plan, PCC/PCI
OIC, NCOIC, RSO, Lane Safeties
Notify the Range Control Firing Desk upon discovery or creation. Mark grid location and halt training if it poses a direct threat to Soldiers.
Safety Brief
OIC, RSO, OC, Safeties, Leaders, Soldiers

subtasks.hazard: Improper handling of ammunition or explosives

values: Leaders must ensure individuals who handle ammunition and pyrotechnics are trained on proper handling procedures and safety.
Soldiers must handle all ammunition with care.
Soldiers must wear eye protection and gloves while handing pyrotechnics, ammunition and crating/packaging material.
Leaders must enforce no smoking except in designated areas.
Have ten (10) pound fire extinguisher(s) on hand at ammo point.
Separate incompatible lots/types of ammunition and explosives.
Ammo shakedown will be conducted after every iteration to ensure all ammunition is accounted for and only the proper ammunition is used for the following iteration
Beach Master will clear each vehicle off of the lane before they continue to the Ammunition Point to Drop off all unexpended ammunition
TACSOP, AR 385-64, DA PAM 385-64, AER 385-64, Risk reduction briefings, Leader Involvement. All Ammo Handlers Certified. AR/DA PAM 385-63/64 , Applicable FM/TM, or Accompanying Instructions
Ammunition NCO and Ammunition Detail

subtasks.hazard: Tactical Vehicle maneuvering IVO of Dismounts

values: Soldiers will adhere to all speed limits when operating around GTA.
Maximum of 5mph if operating within 8 meters of dismounted troops or with a ground guide.
Vehicle movement formations maintain safe and proper following distances.
All Soldiers inside of a tactical vehicle will either be seated in a designated seating platform with a seatbelt, or standing with a restraint harness.
Soldiers will be no higher than name-tape defilade if standing/outside of vehicle while it is moving.
Leaders understand the real world casualty evacuation plan and brief subordinates accordingly.
Soldiers will sleep only in designated areas IAW War Eagle SOP.
Tactical Vehicles will use a ground guide when maneuvering within 10 meters of dismounts.
PCC/PCI, Safety Brief, CONOP, Roll-over Drills, Rehearsals, Concept of Medical Support
OIC, RSO, Safeties, NCOs, VCs, Drivers

subtasks.hazard: Hazardous road conditions as a result of inclement weather (Heavy Rain, slippery roads, etc)

values: Vehicles adhere to all speed limits when operating around GTA.
Vehicles will reduce to speeds IOT allow safe operation of vehicle through terrain.
Vehicle movement formations maintain safe and proper following distances.
PCC/PCI, Safety Brief, CONOP, Roll-over Drills, Rehearsals, Concept of Medical Support
OIC. RSO, NCOs, VCs, Drivers
Soldiers will be given an in-depth safety briefing concerning road safety at GTA.
Leaders will monitor Drivers to ensure proper amount of sleep is achieved.
Leaders ensure a rest plan is in place to ensure drivers are prepared to operate vehicles.
PCC/PCI, Safety Brief, CONOP, Rest Plan
Lane OIC/NCOIC, CDRs, PLs, PSGs, NCOs, VCs, Drivers

subtasks.hazard: Firing Blanks with a Soldier in front of them and less than five feet away.

values: Soldiers will not fire their weapon when another soldier is less than 5 feet in front of them.
Soldier's will "safety kill" OPFOR if they are too close.
Safety/Range Brief
OIC, RSO, NCOIC, Medics, Leaders

subtasks.hazard: Injuring another Soldier with a stun grenade

values: Soldiers will wear proper PPE. Soldiers will only throw stun grenades into empty rooms and not at other soldiers.
PCC/PCI, Safety Brief
OIC, RSO, NCOIC, Medics, Leaders

subtasks.hazard: Improper Use of Weapons Systems and Lasers

values: All soldiers will be qualified on their assigned weapons systems.
All Soldiers will be trained on proper use of equipment prior to range
All weapons will remain oriented in a safe direction.
Safety Brief, SOPs
OIC/NCOIC, Team Leaders, Soldiers

subtasks.hazard: Slips, trips, falls & other misc. injuries

values: Soldiers will execute Crew Qualification in Full Dragoon Standard.
Additional caution will be taken when executing night operations.
Soldiers climbing on top of tactical vehicles wear a helmet and maintain 3-points of contact.
No unharnessed Soldiers when vehicles are moving.
OIC/RSO understands and has briefed MEDEVAC plan on the real world casualty evacuation plan.
A designated vehicle will be marked properly for CASEVAC/MEDEVAC at the range tower.
Driver and Medic/CLS certified person will be briefed on routes, and strip maps with coordinates of AXP stored in vehicle.
Medic will carry medic certification paperwork at all times.
Driver and Medic will remain with MEDEVAC Vehicle at all times.
PCC/PCI, Safety Brief, CONOP, Rehearsals
Lane OIC/NCOIC, Medics, Leaders, Soldiers
Sensitive items accounted for prior to and during training period IAW WE SOP.
All issued sensitive items tied down IAW Troop SOP.
Sensitive items inventory conducted IAW Squadron Recovery SOP.
Briefs, Inspections, Inventory, SOPs, PCC/PCI
Leaders, Soldiers
Range will cease fire if wildlife is on the range or if a fire erupts on the training range and will not go wet until all wildlife/fire has been cleared from range.
Any Soldier that spots wildlife or a fire will call the range to cease fire.
In the case of fire, range control will be called when prompted by the range meister to keep them abreast of the situation.
Fire fighting detail will remain ready with all PPE in the case that they must be deployed to retard fire.
Safety/Range Brief
All Soldiers

subtasks.hazard: Loss of Communication with Range Control

values: If communication with Range Control is lost, Range will immediately cease fire until communication can be returned with Range Control.
DSN, Cell Phone, FM, and Staff Duty will be used to regain communication with Range Control
CONOP, Safety/Range Brief
OIC, RSO, NCOIC, Leaders

draw.overall_supervision_plan: Ensure proper uniform for all Soldiers during training, ensure proper understanding of blanks and the risks associated, brief thorough orientation of training area prior to execution. This is a living document. Newly identified risks will be recorded and mitigated accordingly and risk acceptance will be approved at the appropriate level. If risk exceeds a Commander's authority, the subordinate Commander will provide risk mitigation courses of actions (COAs) to higher headquarters IOT obtain risk acceptance approval.
